items.title: Arkansas Powerball lottery player wins $1.817bn jackpot on Christmas Eve
items.standfirst: It was the second-largest lottery windfall in US history, with a lump-sum cash payment option of $834.9mA Powerball player in Arkansas won a $1.817bn jackpot in Wednesday’s Christmas Eve drawing, ending the lottery game’s three-month stretch without a top-prize winner.Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher than previously expected, making it the second-largest in US history and the largest Powerball prize of 2025, according to www.powerball.com. The jackpot had a lump sum cash payment option of $834.9m. Continue reading...
items.content: It was the second-largest lottery windfall in US history, with a lump-sum cash payment option of $834.9mA Powerball player in Arkansas won a $1.817bn jackpot in Wednesday’s Christmas Eve drawing, ending the lottery game’s three-month stretch without a top-prize winner.Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher than previously expected, making it the second-largest in US history and the largest Powerball prize of 2025, according to www.powerball.com. items.title: A Powerball player in Arkansas has won a $1.817 billion lottery jackpot
items.standfirst: Wednesday's Christmas Eve drawing ended the lottery game's three-month stretch without a top-prize winner. Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher, making it the second-largest in U.S. history.
items.content: Wednesday's Christmas Eve drawing ended the lottery game's three-month stretch without a top-prize winner. Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher, making it the second-largest in U.S. history.(Image credit: Charles Krupa)

items.title: Trump-backed candidate Nasry Asfura declared winner of Honduras' presidential vote
items.standfirst: Asfura won Honduras' presidential election, electoral authorities said Wednesday afternoon, ending a weeks-long count that has whittled away at the credibility of the nation's electoral system.
items.content: Asfura won Honduras' presidential election, electoral authorities said Wednesday afternoon, ending a weeks-long count that has whittled away at the credibility of the nation's electoral system.(Image credit: Moises Castillo)

items.title: Trump-backed candidate Asfura declared new president of Honduras
items.standfirst: Winning margin of 28,000 votes announced a month late but before review of all ‘inconsistent’ ballots was completedDonald Trump-backed candidate Nasry “Tito” Asfura has been declared the winner of Honduras’s presidential election after a vote count that dragged on for almost a month and was marred by fraud allegations and criticism of interference by the US president.The rightwing Asfura, 67, a construction magnate and former mayor of the capital, Tegucigalpa, secured 40.27% of the vote, against 39.53% for the centre-right Salvador Nasralla, a margin of just 28,000 votes. Continue reading...
items.content: Winning margin of 28,000 votes announced a month late but before review of all ‘inconsistent’ ballots was completedDonald Trump-backed candidate Nasry “Tito” Asfura has been declared the winner of Honduras’s presidential election after a vote count that dragged on for almost a month and was marred by fraud allegations and criticism of interference by the US president.The rightwing Asfura, 67, a construction magnate and former mayor of the capital, Tegucigalpa, secured 40.27% of the vote, against 39.53% for the centre-right Salvador Nasralla, a margin of just 28,000 votes. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump-backed Nasry Asfura declared winner of Honduras presidency
items.standfirst: Conservative businessman Nasry Asfura, backed by Donald Trump, was declared the winner of Honduras' presidential election on Wednesday, three weeks after a vote marked by a very narrow margin and allegations of fraud, signaling a return to conservatism for the country. The US president had given his unequivocal support to Asfura ahead of the election.
items.content: Conservative businessman Nasry Asfura, backed by Donald Trump, was declared the winner of Honduras' presidential election on Wednesday, three weeks after a vote marked by a very narrow margin and allegations of fraud, signaling a return to conservatism for the country. The US president had given his unequivocal support to Asfura ahead of the election.

items.title: Pope speaks of Gaza's suffering, urges direct talks on Ukraine war in first Christmas blessing
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV delivered his first Christmas “Urbi et Orbi” blessing from Vatican City on Thursday, at the end of a year overshadowed by conflict around the world, urging Ukraine and Russia to find the 'courage' to hold direct peace talks and speaking of the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV delivered his first Christmas “Urbi et Orbi” blessing from Vatican City on Thursday, at the end of a year overshadowed by conflict around the world, urging Ukraine and Russia to find the 'courage' to hold direct peace talks and speaking of the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza.

items.title: DOJ says it may need a 'few more weeks' to finish releasing Epstein files
items.standfirst: The Justice Department said Wednesday that it may need a "few more weeks" to release its records on the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after discovering more than a million potentially relevant documents.
items.content: The Justice Department said Wednesday that it may need a "few more weeks" to release its records on the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after discovering more than a million potentially relevant documents.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Officials discover a million more documents potentially related to Epstein case
items.standfirst: The US Department of Justice says reviewing the material could delay the full release of Epstein documents by a "few more weeks".
items.content: The US Department of Justice says reviewing the material could delay the full release of Epstein documents by a "few more weeks".

items.title: Over a million more documents linked to Jeffrey Epstein discovered, DOJ says
items.standfirst: The US Department of Justice announced on Wednesday that more than a million additional documents potentially related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have been found. Officials said the files are being reviewed and redacted to protect victims, with release expected to take a few more weeks, missing the December 19 deadline set by the Epstein Files Transparency Act.
items.content: The US Department of Justice announced on Wednesday that more than a million additional documents potentially related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have been found. Officials said the files are being reviewed and redacted to protect victims, with release expected to take a few more weeks, missing the December 19 deadline set by the Epstein Files Transparency Act.

items.title: DOJ says "over a million more documents" potentially related to Epstein found
items.standfirst: The Justice Department said the process of releasing the Epstein files may take "a few more weeks" due to the volume of materials.
items.content: The Justice Department said the process of releasing the Epstein files may take "a few more weeks" due to the volume of materials.

items.title: Trump trips, a fake video and 10 possible co-conspirators: Takeaways from new Epstein files
items.standfirst: The largest release of Epstein-related documents yet from the justice department included some notable messages and several mentions of Trump.
items.content: The largest release of Epstein-related documents yet from the justice department included some notable messages and several mentions of Trump.

clusters.title: A humble Christmas celebration marks hope for an end to suffering in Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: First Christmas in Gaza in two years: A story of hope and survival

items.title: A humble Christmas celebration marks hope for an end to suffering in Gaza
items.standfirst: For two years, Christmas has gone without celebration for the tiny Christian community in the war-torn Gaza Strip, where more than 70,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel’s war against Hamas, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry. The war began with Hamas’ Oct. 7, 2023, attack on Israel, in which more than 1,200 people were killed and 251 people were taken hostage.
items.content: For two years, Christmas has gone without celebration for the tiny Christian community in the war-torn Gaza Strip, where more than 70,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel’s war against Hamas, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry. The war began with Hamas’ Oct. 7, 2023, attack on Israel, in which more than 1,200 people were killed and 251 people were taken hostage.

items.content: Joy is returning to Jerusalem as Christians mark Christmas in one of the world’s oldest cities. FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky reports a festive atmosphere in the air, describing it as "a huge relief” after more than two years of war in Gaza.

items.title: For Palestinian Christians, return of Bethlehem celebrations mark opportunity to revive hope
items.standfirst: The thousands-year-old Christmas procession from Jerusalem to Bethlehem is finally being celebrated with festive fanfare after a two-year pause to mourn the devastating war in Gaza.
items.content: The thousands-year-old Christmas procession from Jerusalem to Bethlehem is finally being celebrated with festive fanfare after a two-year pause to mourn the devastating war in Gaza.

clusters.title: Trump promises to guard against "bad Santa" in Christmas Eve calls with kids
clusters.neutral_headline: Where is Santa now? Trump answers kids' Christmas calls to Norad tracker

items.title: Trump promises to guard against "bad Santa" in Christmas Eve calls with kids
items.standfirst: President Trump spent part of Christmas Eve bantering with kids, updating families on NORAD's Santa tracker and reminding one child that the big guy has a "serious appetite."
items.content: President Trump spent part of Christmas Eve bantering with kids, updating families on NORAD's Santa tracker and reminding one child that the big guy has a "serious appetite."

items.title: Where is Santa now? Trump answers kids' Christmas calls to Norad tracker
items.standfirst: Norad got some help from President Donald Trump as it marked its 70th year tracking Santa Claus on Christmas Eve.
items.content: Norad got some help from President Donald Trump as it marked its 70th year tracking Santa Claus on Christmas Eve.

clusters.title: Algerian law declares France's colonisation a crime
clusters.neutral_headline: Algerian law declares France's colonisation a crime

items.title: Algerian law declares France's colonisation a crime
items.standfirst: Lawmakers unanimously approve a law, which demands an apology and reparations from the former colonial power.
items.content: Lawmakers unanimously approve a law, which demands an apology and reparations from the former colonial power.

items.title: Algeria passes law declaring French colonisation a crime
items.standfirst: France’s rule over Algeria from 1830 to 1962 is marked by mass killings and large-scale deportationAlgeria’s parliament has unanimously approved a law declaring France’s colonisation of the country a crime and demanded an apology and reparations.Lawmakers, standing in the chamber wearing scarves in the colours of the national flag, chanted “long live Algeria” on Wednesday as they applauded the passage of the bill, which states that France holds “legal responsibility for its colonial past in Algeria and the tragedies it caused”. Continue reading...
